unit_learning_outcomes.description: Synthesize complex medical knowledge to facilitate clear and accurate approaches when communicating critical information to affected individuals and their families.
Demonstrate a scholarly understanding of the brain by identifying the visual disturbance and disability experienced as a result of neurological conditions.
Reflect on current policy that guides sector approaches to people with vision impairment to support stakeholder understanding and advocacy, and to inform future professional approaches.

Demonstrate advanced clincial and functional knowledge of combined vision impairment, brain injury and/or developmental disabilities to formulate suitable management plans for complex individual cases
Apply knowledge of human anatomy and body systems to contextualise the impact of complex medical conditions on the human body.

enrolment_rules.description: (SPED8926 or SPED926) and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Based on a theoretical framework, analysis of two strategies from the literature that may assist in working with individuals with complex needs, reflecting on individual preparedness. (2000 words)

data.description: This course extends and develops concepts and learning introduced in SPED8926 Introduction to Vision Impairment, with a particular focus on individuals and groups with complex support needs. The student's knowledge and understanding of the substantial challenges for individual, family and community arising from blindness and vision impairment will be developed.
data.title: Complex Vision Impairment
